voiceProfile.positioning: Employee-owned firm operating as trusted advisors with a team-oriented culture, strong state presence, and commitment to high ethical standards.
differentiators: 100% employee-owned structure aligns incentives with client success
200+ employees with 12+ state offices beyond DC
Strongest state government relations footprint among competitors
Standout client retention rates per Bloomberg Government
Founded 2002, built on trusted-advisor model vs. hired-gun approach

firms.firmIntro: Founded in 2002 by a group of professionals with a shared philosophy and a different approach to the business, Cornerstone Government Affairs has grown into one of Washington's most effective consulting firms. In 2016, recognizing the importance of our collaborative culture and commitment to team approach, we became employee-owned through an ESOP, ensuring that every professional shares in the firm's growth and prosperity. Today, Cornerstone is a full-service, bipartisan firm with over 200 professionals across 14 states and Washington, D.C. At our core, we focus on solving problems and creating opportunities for our clients. We view ourselves not as hired guns, but rather as trusted advisors, proud of our high ethical standards and the team-oriented culture that provides clients the full depth and breadth of our expertise, experience, and relationships.

voiceProfile.positioning: Nation's leading federal lobbying firm driven by an experienced bipartisan team that tackles high-stakes, intractable issues with strategic insight and deep policy expertise.
differentiators: #1 federal lobbying firm by revenue ($56.25M in 2021)
Growth story: Denver startup in 1968 to national powerhouse
250+ attorneys and policy consultants across 13 offices
Law firm foundation provides regulatory and litigation support
Strong Western states presence unlike DC-centric competitors

firms.firmIntro: Founded in Denver in 1968 by three law school friends, Brownstein Hyatt Farber Schreck has grown from its Western roots into a national powerhouse. For more than fifty years, the firm has positioned itself at the intersection of law, business, and policy, combining outstanding lawyers with leading policy authorities to solve clients' toughest challenges. Our established bipartisan team operates from 14 offices nationwide, and we've consistently ranked as the nation's largest lobbying firm by federal revenue. At Brownstein, we're all in.

firms.firmIntro: Holland & Knight's Public Policy & Regulation Group combines the resources of one of the nation's largest law firms with a team built to operate more like a campaign than a traditional legal practice. Our interdisciplinary approach integrates lawyers, lobbyists, and strategic communications professionals to provide clients with comprehensive analysis of the legal, political, regulatory, and media dimensions of every issue they face. Led by Rich Gold, one of only three practitioners ranked Band 1 in Chambers USA's Nationwide Government Relations category, our practice has grown into the third largest federal lobbying operation in the country by revenue. Whether advancing legislation on Capitol Hill, navigating complex regulatory proceedings, or managing high-stakes crises, Holland & Knight's campaign-style advocacy is built to break through the noise and achieve client goals.

firms.firmIntro: The smartest people solving the hardest problems since 2007. That's Invariant. Founded by Heather Podesta, Invariant has grown into the largest lobbying firm individually owned by anyone in the country, advising some of the world's most sophisticated companies, trade associations, and nonprofits on how to make Washington work for them. We move small mountains: sophisticated advocacy, threat assessment, legislative and regulatory analysis, coalition building, crisis management, and strategic communications. Our bipartisan team doesn't just understand the complexities of the policy process; we know how to turn that understanding into outcomes. We advise the biggest brands. Maybe you'd like to be one.

firms.firmIntro: Founded in 1991 by former White House officials Haley Barbour and Ed Rogers, BGR Government Affairs has built a reputation for excellence over more than three decades in Washington. Named by Fortune as the capital's most influential lobbying firm, BGR specializes in creating, implementing, and changing public policy under the most difficult circumstances. Our bipartisan team combines senior-level experience across the White House, Congress, and the Executive Branch with uncommon strategic vision to deliver results regardless of which party controls the halls of power.

firms.firmIntro: Squire Patton Boggs operates one of the world's largest public policy and lobbying practices, formed through the 2014 merger of global law firm Squire Sanders with Patton Boggs, then the nation's leading lobbying firm by revenue. With more than 40 offices in 20 countries, our public policy team offers clients the ability to integrate the relevant legal, regulatory, and policy components into a unified strategy grounded in law and supported by policy. We get the hard assignments: pension reform, national cannabis legislation, the US-China bilateral relationship, the space launch industry, and tax reform among them. Our exceptionally deep bench includes former government officials and senior congressional staffers who bring decades of experience in the legislative and executive branches. Clients come to us when confronting difficult, complex, and high-profile challenges to their business.

firms.firmIntro:
Van Scoyoc Associates is the largest independent lobbying firm in Washington, D.C., founded in 1990 by Stu Van Scoyoc with three employees, eight clients, and a five-pound cell phone. For more than 30 years, VSA has been developing and executing tailored government affairs strategies for clients ranging from Fortune 500 companies to small towns, research universities, and charitable organizations. Early on, VSA made a deliberate decision not to hire former Members of Congress, choosing instead to focus on the long game in Washington by assembling a deep, talented, bipartisan team of policy experts. This commitment has paid off: according to Bloomberg Government, VSA enjoys the highest ranking for client retention among its competitors. While growing into one of the most successful firms in D.C., we have never forgotten where we started, which is why every client continues to get the personal attention of a small, entrepreneurial company.

The right message, to the right person, at the right time.

firms.firmIntro: S-3 Group is a boutique government relations and public affairs consultancy with a proven record of securing wins in high-stakes public policy fights. In Washington today, influence is no longer wielded solely by a few powerful voices; it's just as likely to be molded by small groups of well-organized voices online, in the streets, or at town halls. That's why S-3 takes an integrated approach to every client's challenge, bringing together the power of subject matter expertise, reach, and experience with the latest stakeholder engagement methods. Our bipartisan team of senior strategists and operatives has decades of experience winning legislative, regulatory, and reputation battles, with strong relationships where it counts: Hill leadership, appropriators, key committees, the White House, and federal agencies. Founded by John Scofield, with partners regularly named among The Hill's Top Lobbyists, S-3 creates unprecedented influence for clients of all sizes.

firms.firmIntro:
Fulcrum Public Affairs is a 100% Black and Latino-owned, full-service bipartisan government affairs firm founded by Dana J. Thompson and Oscar Ramirez. Dana, the first African American to serve as director of a U.S. governor's Washington office, and Oscar, a former senior advisor to the Secretary of Labor in the Obama Administration, bring decades of experience at the highest levels of government. Named the "top-earning new firm" by Bloomberg Government in 2019 and a Top-Performing Lobbying Firm every year since, Fulcrum has been recognized by The Hill as one of Washington's fastest-growing lobby shops and by Punchbowl News as a firm "poised to do well in the new Washington." We leverage our wide-ranging backgrounds to give clients reach into all spheres of influence, from Congress and the Administration to state and local policymakers to think tanks and advocacy groups. Our dynamic team's campaign-style approach yields innovative strategies that give our clients a seat at the table to achieve successful outcomes.

Principle. Passion. Purpose.

firms.firmIntro: We named the company after a parking lot on Capitol Hill. It's a pretty unglamorous piece of pavement, but it's one of the places where the people who actually write legislation start and end their day. In a city full of show horses, Lot Sixteen offers a different profile: an energetic and fearless team of lobbying and communications professionals who dig deep on policy and work as hard as the staffers we're trying to persuade. We've seen first-hand how deep issue expertise, paired with creative communications, can break down walls and advance agendas. If you want a firm with the guts, perspective, and maturity to give you an honest assessment of when, where, and how to invest—and where not to—you've found it.

firms.firmIntro:
Founded in 2018 by veteran lobbyist Cristina Antelo, Ferox Strategies is a small but savvy firm that delivers big-firm results with the hustle and innovation of a start-up. Recognized by Bloomberg Government as a Top-Performing Lobbying Firm for five consecutive years, Ferox has built unrivaled relationships with policymakers and thought leaders inside the Beltway and beyond. Our bipartisan team of longtime Hill staffers, lawyers, and financial experts is built to be agile, efficient, and effective. We think fast and act fast for our clients, especially in a crisis. We don't wait for luck; we build it. We're more than a sounding board; we're a step ahead, knowing our clients so well that insight, advice, and strategy often come before the ask. Informed, decisive, and available, we get it right.

Hustle is our strategy.

firms.firmIntro: In turbulent times of constant breaking news, frenzied legislative activity, and unprecedented political uncertainty, the Klein/Johnson Group helps clients tune out the noise and focus on what's truly important to their bottom lines. Founded in 2017 by Matt Johnson and Israel "Izzy" Klein, KJG is a bipartisan lobbying and public policy firm built around a simple premise: high-impact, clear-eyed strategy wins. Named to The Hill's Top Lobbyists list for six consecutive years, and recently strengthened by the acquisition of Perry Bayliss Government Relations, Klein/Johnson delivers the level-headed disposition and creative solutions clients need when the stakes are high.

firms.firmIntro: Federal Street Strategies is a full-service government relations firm founded by Paul Brathwaite, a widely known and well-regarded fixture in the halls of Congress recognized for both his consummate professionalism and his ebullient spirit. Paul brings more than two decades of government relations experience, including six years as Executive Director of the Congressional Black Caucus under three CBC chairs and service as Deputy Assistant Secretary of Labor in the Clinton Administration. Named "Lobbyist of the Year" by the Washington Government Relations Group, Paul has built a firm that specializes in understanding each client's needs and helping them navigate the inner workings of the federal government. With a proven track record of helping clients work with Members in the House and Senate on both sides of the aisle, Federal Street delivers results across financial services, health care, transportation and infrastructure, telecommunications, education, and the nonprofit sector.

firms.firmIntro:
Cogent Strategies was founded in 2017 by veteran public affairs CEO Kimberley Fritts on a set of core principles: hard work, clarity, and ingenuity. In Washington's sea of lobbying firms, Cogent stands out as a proud, certified woman-owned small business that understands there is a new playbook for advancing an agenda in the capital. Traditional, transactional shoe-leather lobbying isn't enough anymore. The landscape has changed, and Cogent has the new roadmap. Our bipartisan team marries policy substance with incisive storytelling, leveraging government relations expertise, public relations smarts, and data-driven solutions to change outcomes for clients. Doggedly inventive and recognized by Bloomberg Government as a Standout and High-Performing firm, we approach each project from every angle, turning over every stone for clients big and small.

Clear. Compelling. Convincing. This is Cogent.
